# Raw data 

## Data structure

Publicly available testing data are daily aggregated, splitting by `Outcome_tests`:

```{r echo=FALSE, layout="l-body-outset"}
testing <- read_rds("data/BAG-open/positivity.rds")
# View(testing)

testing %>% 
  slice(1:4)
```

## Example: first case:

```{r echo=FALSE}
testing %>% 
  filter(Date == as.Date("2020-02-24"))
```

## 7 day rolling average

```{r}
testing %<>% 
  group_by(Date) %>% 
  summarise(Number_of_tests = sum(Number_of_tests)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  mutate(Number_of_tests_07da = zoo::rollmean(Number_of_tests, k = 7, fill = NA)) %>% 
  mutate(Week = as.integer(format(Date, format = "%V"))) %>% 
  arrange(Date)
```

<!-- ------------------------------------------------------------ --> 

# Temporal overview

## Daily tests

```{r echo=FALSE, layout="l-body-outset"}
testing %>% 
  filter(Date < as.Date("2020-11-23")) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = Date)) + 
  geom_col(aes(y = Number_of_tests)) + 
  geom_line(aes(y = Number_of_tests_07da), color = "red") + 
  xlab("") + ylab("Number of tests")
```

## Weekly overview:

```{r echo=FALSE, layout="l-body-outset"}
testing %>% 
  # filter(Week > 4) %>% 
  group_by(Week) %>% 
  summarize(Number_of_tests = sum(Number_of_tests)) %>% 
  ggplot() + 
  geom_col(aes(x = as.factor(Week), y = Number_of_tests)) + 
  xlab("Week") + ylab("Number of tests")
```

<!-- ------------------------------------------------------------ --> 

# Time adjusted GAM models 

## Daily data

```{r}
min_date <- as.numeric(min(testing$Date))

testing %<>% 
  arrange(Date) %>% 
  mutate(Day = as.numeric(Date) - min_date + 1)

testing %>% 
  ggplot(aes(Number_of_tests)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1000)
```


```{r}
model_time_day_01 <- gam(Number_of_tests ~  s(Day), 
                         data = testing, 
                         family = gaussian(link = "identity"))
```


```{r, layout="l-body-outset"}
summary(model_time_day_01)
# gam.check(model_time_day_01)
# plot(model_time_day_01, pages=1)

draw(model_time_day_01)
appraise(model_time_day_01)
```

## Weekly data

```{r}
testing_weekly <- testing %>% 
  # filter(Week > 4) %>% 
  group_by(Week) %>% 
  summarize(Number_of_tests = sum(Number_of_tests))

testing_weekly %>% 
  ggplot(aes(Number_of_tests)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 10000)
```


```{r}
model_time_week_01 <- gam(Number_of_tests ~  s(Week), 
                          data = testing_weekly, 
                          family = gaussian(link = "identity"))
```


```{r, layout="l-body-outset"}
summary(model_time_week_01)
# gam.check(model_time_week_01)
# plot(model_time_week_01, pages=1)

draw(model_time_week_01)
appraise(model_time_week_01)
```
